newsitem.title: CUBA: Cuba opens second free trade zone.
newsitem.headline: Cuba opens second free trade zone.

text.p: Cuba opened the Havana City Free Trade Zone on Wednesday, the second special commercial and manufacturing zone to be started up this week on the communist-ruled Caribbean island.

"This consititutes an additional option for the foreign investor," Foreign Investment Minister Ibrahim Ferradaz said in a brief speech to inaugurate the 244-hectare (600-acre) warehouse complex, part of it still under construction.
The Havana City Free Trade Zone, the second of four such zones which the Cuban authorities have planned to open this year, is sited in the Berroa Valley just east of Havana port.
It will be run by a subsidiary of the Cuban hard currency corporation CIMEX.
On Monday, Cuba opened the Wajay Free Trade Zone, a smaller installation next to Havana International Airport.
The other two free trade and manufacturing zones still to be inaugurated will be at the port of Mariel, west of Havana and at Cienfuegos port on the south-central coast.

The Cuban zones, modelled on similar zones already existing in the Caribbean and other parts of the world, offer tax concessions and other operating facilities and are intended to try to attract additional foreign investment.
